question:
Which of the following relations are functions? Give reasons.
(i) $\{(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4), (4, 5)\}$
(ii) $\{(1, 2), (1, 3), (2, 4)\}$
(iii) $\{(a, x), (b, y), (c, z), (d, z)\}$
solutionSteps: (i) $\{(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4), (4, 5)\}$: Every element in the domain has a unique image. It is a function.
(ii) $\{(1, 2), (1, 3), (2, 4)\}$: Element 1 has two images (2 and 3). It is not a function.
(iii) $\{(a, x), (b, y), (c, z), (d, z)\}$: Every element in the domain has a unique image (c and d both map to z, which is allowed). It is a function.

question:
Find the domain and range of the following real functions:
(i) $f(x) = |x - 3|$
(ii) $f(x) = \sqrt{16 - x^2}$
solutionSteps: (i) $f(x) = |x - 3|$: Defined for all real numbers. Domain = $R$. Since absolute value is non-negative, range is $[0, \infty)$.

(ii) $f(x) = \sqrt{16 - x^2}$: Defined when $16 - x^2 \ge 0 \Rightarrow x^2 \le 16 \Rightarrow -4 \le x \le 4$. Domain = $[-4, 4]$. For range, $y = \sqrt{16-x^2} \ge 0$. Also $y^2 = 16 - x^2 \le 16 \Rightarrow y \le 4$. Range = $[0, 4]$.
